snippet: The documentary “Afternoon of a Faun: Tanaquil Le Clercq” traces the life of a great ballerina who was paralyzed by polio at the height of her career.
abstract: Stephen Holden reviews documentary film Afternoon of a Faun: Tanaquil Le Clercq, directed by Nancy Buirski.
lead_paragraph: The documentary “Afternoon of a Faun: Tanaquil Le Clercq” traces the life of a great ballerina who was paralyzed by polio at the height of her career.

headline.seo: The Unusual Story of Tanaquil Le Clercq, Artist and Muse
headline.main: A Dancer’s Rare Grace Survives a Horrible Fate
